content.statement: vascular:renal:renal-003-fmd is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Renal-Artery that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:renal:renal-003-fmd helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:renal:renal-003-fmd include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:renal:renal-003-fmd.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

medial_fibroplasia.appearance: String of beads with beads LARGER than normal diameter

intimal_fibroplasia.appearance: Focal stenosis or long tubular narrowing, beads smaller than normal diameter

perimedial_fibroplasia.appearance: String of beads with beads smaller than normal diameter

associated_conditions.carotid_FMD: 65% of renal FMD patients - screen with duplex

diagnosis.duplex: May show turbulent flow, less reliable than for atherosclerosis
diagnosis.CTA_MRA: String of beads appearance, mid-to-distal location
diagnosis.angiography: Gold standard, defines extent for intervention

angioplasty.technique: Balloon angioplasty alone - no stent needed
angioplasty.outcomes: 50-70% cure or significant improvement of hypertension

treatment.stenting: Rarely needed - reserved for dissection or recoil
treatment.surgery: Rarely indicated - failed angioplasty, branch involvement, aneurysm

definition.@value: Non-atherosclerotic, non-inflammatory arteriopathy of the renal artery characterized by alternating stenoses and dilations, predominantly affecting young women, causing renovascular hypertension often curable with angioplasty.

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the clinical features and demographics of renal FMD
Recognize the angiographic appearance of medial fibroplasia
Understand why angioplasty alone (no stent) is effective
Identify associated vascular conditions requiring screening
clinical_pearls: FMD is YOUNG WOMEN - if you see renovascular HTN in a 30-year-old female, think FMD
String of beads with beads LARGER than artery = medial fibroplasia (90%)
NO STENT needed - angioplasty alone works because vessel wall is normal between lesions
Always screen for CAROTID FMD (65%) and INTRACRANIAL ANEURYSMS (7-15%)
Lesions are MID-TO-DISTAL - atherosclerosis is OSTIAL
